PARAM.name: deny
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: discard
PARAM.help: Do not forward the packet. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: permit
PARAM.help: Allow packet to be forwarded and trapped to CPU

PARAM.name: transit
PARAM.help: Allow traffic to be forwarded. Do not allow trap to CPU

PARAM.name: do-not-nat
PARAM.help: Do not allow NAT processing for the packet

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

PARAM.name: remark-val
PARAM.help: Remark or description for rule

PARAM.name: ip-protocol-val
PARAM.help: Protocol number (0 to 255)

PARAM.name: arg1
PARAM.help: arg2 Packets

PARAM.name: arg3
PARAM.help: Any arg4 Packets

PARAM.name: tcp
PARAM.help: TCP packets

PARAM.name: udp
PARAM.help: UDP packets

PARAM.name: arg1-ip-prefix
PARAM.help: arg3 prefix

PARAM.name: arg1-ip-any
PARAM.help: Any arg2 address

PARAM.name: arg1-ip-host
PARAM.help: arg2 IP address

PARAM.name: arg1-ip
PARAM.help: arg3 IP address value

PARAM.name: arg1-eq
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP arg2 port equal to the given port number

PARAM.name: arg1-port1
PARAM.help: arg3 port number

PARAM.name: arg1-gt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP arg2 port greater than the given port number

PARAM.name: arg1-port1
PARAM.help: arg3 port number

PARAM.name: arg1-lt
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP arg2 port lesser than the given port number

PARAM.name: arg1-port1
PARAM.help: arg3 port number

PARAM.name: arg1-range
PARAM.help: Match packets with TCP/UDP arg2 port in the given range

PARAM.name: arg1-port1
PARAM.help: arg3 port begin

PARAM.name: arg1-port2
PARAM.help: arg3 port end. Must be greater than arg2 port begin.

PARAM.name: tcp-established
PARAM.help: Match packets which are part of established TCP session

PARAM.name: fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-fin
PARAM.help: Match packets with FIN TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-syn
PARAM.help: Match packets with SYN TCP Flag cleared

PARAM.name: rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-rst
PARAM.help: Match packets with RST TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-psh
PARAM.help: Match packets with PSH TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-ack
PARAM.help: Match packets with ACK TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag set

PARAM.name: not-urg
PARAM.help: Match packets with URG TCP flag cleared

PARAM.name: type
PARAM.help: Match packets using arg3 type

PARAM.name: TYPE
PARAM.help: arg3 type

PARAM.name: code
PARAM.help: Match packets using arg3 code

PARAM.name: CODE
PARAM.help: arg3 code

PARAM.name: vlan
PARAM.help: Match packets using VLAN ID value

PARAM.name: vlan-val
PARAM.help: VLAN ID value (range 1-4094)

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Set remark or description for rule

PARAM.name: remark-val
PARAM.help: Remark or description for rule

PARAM.help: Match packets with CS0 DSCP (000000 - Decimal value 0)

PARAM.name: cs7
PARAM.help: Match packets with CS7 DSCP (111000 - Decimal value 56)

COMMAND.name: no
COMMAND.help: Negate a command or set its defaults

PARAM.name: seq-no
PARAM.help: Sequence number

PARAM.name: remark
PARAM.help: Clear remark or description for rule

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Delete ACL rule or remark associated with the rule.

COMMAND.name: remark
COMMAND.help: Set remark or description for ACL

PARAM.name: remark-val
PARAM.help: Remark or description for ACL

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Set an ACL remark or description.
DOCGEN.USAGE: Remark with spaces should be mentioned in double quotes.

COMMAND.name: no remark
COMMAND.help: Clear remark or description for ACL

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of access-list (Max size 63)

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

PARAM.name: in
PARAM.help: Apply access-list at ingress direction

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of access-list (Max size 63)

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

PARAM.name: out
PARAM.help: Apply access-list in outgoing direction

PARAM.name: access-list-name
PARAM.help: Name of access-list (Max size 63)

PARAM.name: direction-switch
PARAM.help: Configure the direction to apply the access list

PARAM.name: in
PARAM.help: Apply access-list at ingress direction

PARAM.name: out
PARAM.help: Apply access-list at egress direction

COMMAND.name: mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply MAC ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type MAC to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply MAC ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv4 ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv4 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply IPv4 ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Apply IPv6 ACL to an interface.
DOCGEN.USAGE: ACL must be created first and must be of type IPv6 to be applied. Only 1 ACL of a given type can be applied per interface and per direction.

EXAMPLE.summary: Apply IPv6 ACL to an interface

COMMAND.name: no mac access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify MAC access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove MAC ACL application to an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Vlan100)# no mac access-group macacl-example in

COMMAND.name: no ip access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IP access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv4 ACL application to an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-po1)# no ip access-group ipacl-example out

COMMAND.name: no ipv6 access-group
COMMAND.help: Specify IPv6 access control for packets

DOCGEN.DESCRIPTION: Remove IPv6 ACL application to an interface.
DOCGEN.EXAMPLE: sonic(conf-if-Eth1/1)# no ipv6 access-group ipv6acl-example out

PARAM.help: Critical applications (3)

PARAM.name: pcp-vi
PARAM.help: Video, < 100 ms latency and jitter (4)

PARAM.name: pcp-vo
PARAM.help: Voice, < 10 ms latency and jitter (5)

PARAM.name: pcp-ic
PARAM.help: Internetwork control (6)

PARAM.name: pcp-nc
PARAM.help: Network control (7)

PARAM.name: pcp-val
PARAM.help: PCP value. (range 0-7)

PARAM.name: pcp-mask
PARAM.help: PCP value mask

PARAM.name: pcp-val-mask
PARAM.help: PCP value mask (range 0-7)
